title: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
description: The BS in Computer Science program at the Department of CSE provides a comprehensive foundation in computer science principles, software development, algorithms, and data structures. Students gain hands-on experience through projects and internships, preparing them for careers in software engineering, systems analysis, and research.
admissionRequirements: High school diploma with strong background in mathematics and science. Minimum GPA of 3.0 required. SAT score of at least 1200 or equivalent ACT score.
careerProspects: Graduates find employment as software engineers, systems analysts, database administrators, and IT consultants in both public and private sectors. Average starting salary is $72,000 per year.

departmentInfo.name: Department of Computer Science and Engineering
departmentInfo.address: Computer Science Building, University Campus, 123 University Avenue
achievements: Ranked in the top 50 CS departments nationally
More than 85% placement rate within 6 months of graduation
Strong industry partnerships with leading tech companies

title: Masters of Science in Computer Science and Engineering
description: The MS in Computer Science and Engineering program is designed for students seeking advanced knowledge in computer science theory and applications. The curriculum emphasizes research methodology and specialized topics in emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence, cloud computing, and cybersecurity.
admissionRequirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field with minimum GPA of 3.2. GRE scores required. Statement of purpose and three letters of recommendation.
careerProspects: Graduates are prepared for roles in research and development, advanced software engineering, data science, and academia. Average salary range is $90,000-$120,000 depending on specialization.

departmentInfo.name: Department of Computer Science and Engineering

achievements: Ranked in the top 50 CS departments nationally

title: Doctor of Philosophy in Physics
description: The PhD in Physics program prepares students for research careers in physics, focusing on theoretical and experimental methodologies. Students conduct original research in various specializations including quantum mechanics, astrophysics, and condensed matter physics.
admissionRequirements: Master's degree in Physics or related field. Research experience and strong recommendation letters required.
careerProspects: Graduates pursue careers in academic research, national laboratories, aerospace industry, and technology research centers.

departmentInfo.name: Department of Physics
departmentInfo.address: Physics Building, University Campus, 456 Science Avenue
achievements: Ranked in the top 30 Physics departments nationally
Strong research output in quantum physics
